intro: Clibadium sessile, commonly known as the sessile sumpweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate in shape and often have a slightly pubescent surface. Clibadium sessile is typically found in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and in wetlands.
